@a_of
The point of Kai was recreating the anime for the future, and cutting the cruft. Backgrounds were reused and new artwork was created to recreate the series in 16:9, and that's how the Blu-rays come (16:9, 1080p). So either someone actively decided to reformat these to 4:3, or this is an upscale job from another source (TV?).
Only change I noticed between this and DBZ is the Opening and the Ending...

@Narrat0r

Well the story difference is pacing. The original Sayian saga was 35 episodes (that is, the first episode, to the point were Vegeta is defeated). In Kai, a lot of the unnecessary gesturing is gone, so the entire Sayain saga goes from 35 episodes to 16 (less than half).

To those arguing that these are supposed to be 16:9 try doing a little research next time.  The original series was 4:3 and so are the remastered versions.  The only reason you see 16:9 mentioned anywhere about the series is due to the fact that Japan has laws requiring anything show on TV to be broadcast in wide-screen.  Therefore, the versions shown on TV over there were cropped to make them 16:9 please see this comparison to see just how much is lost: http://comparescreenshots.slicx.com/comparison/57200

Going back on the topic of the aspect ratio, and let me make clear that im on  niether side.
The 4:3 is indeed the original aspect ratios but the film masters still had information on the left and right sides. In the 16:9 version those left and right sides where digitally remastered and restores producing new frames basically refilming the entire series over. The fact still stands that there is cropping but isnt as bad as a complete crop. if you look at the comparison you will notice there is more of the scene to the left and right in the 16:9 version then there is on the 4:3 version, in contrast the 4:3 version has more of the scene on the top and bottom. So either way both versions are Cropping something, and personally I have both versions (downloaded) and love them both, If you guys can wait, I Plan on making a remaster of my own, combining the 16:9 and 4:3 versions together and also replacing the intro to the original (i think the new one sucks).
My Encoder name is TizzyT. Im not the wide yet but working on this series might spread me around LOL.
